Fields.DialogueText: Someone's in the kitchen with Nevada! Someone's in the kitchen I know-ow-ow... Oh, hi, Captain!
What are you doing, Nevada?
Trying a special recipe– Chateaubriand. It's a Basque triple-layer steak dish.
Triple?
You cook three steaks together, but then you throw out the thinner two and keep the middle.
Nevada, it's not good to waste food on a ship.
Don't worry about that – one for you, one for me, and one for the crew. Question is, who gets the main course?
Let me guess: you want to make a bet?
Here, I'll cover the dishes. Now I'm shuffling them, so you don't know which is which. Now, take your pick, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: The left one.
The middle one.
Just tell me!

Fields.DialogueText: Beep! Wrong! Enjoy the discard!
Nice guess, Captain. Wrong, but nice.
Pft... Very well, the answer for that is...nothing!
Just kidding, Captain! I had the third one behind my back all along.
So I never had a chance to begin with.
Well, to be a good sport, I suppose I could give the prize to you. Just not right now.
Why not?
Because we're about to be medium rare ourselves, if those Morganas flanking us have their way!
@BATTLE
The c-
Wait! No, we're gonna make this interesting!
Say, Captain, you've traveled before, right? Not like we're doing now, I mean, but as a private citizen.
Well, a little...
Good! Hypothetically, which city would make the best starting point for an American tour after the war – New York or San Francisco?
New York, maybe? But it will depend a lot on how things go.
Yeah, I was thinking of New York, too. Only problem is it might get congested.
I'm sure the naval board will keep victory celebrations orderly.
Oh, I'm not talking about the port. I meant the streets. Like weaving through a minefield...
Streets? Exactly what is this "hypothetical" scenario you're thinking of?
A road trip, silly!
A road trip. But that's not...
Yep! I'm thinking of taking that Route 66 – though they had the audacity to skip right by my state!

Fields.MenuText: Why not Route 65?
Nevada, let's focus on the war first.
Um, are you sure a road trip is the best idea?

Fields.DialogueText: Ha, ha, good one, Captain! Wait... There is a state Route 65 through my home. Thanks for the idea!
Aw... Party pooper.
Why wouldn't it be? If we can beat the Morganas, then crossing the land will be a piece of cake!
But for now, back to business. We need to make sure that the nation and the world are safe before we ask for a vacation.
Right you are. General quarters, on the double. We're closing on Morganas!
@BATTLE
Nevada?
Oh, Captain! Hey, could you hand me that wrench on the left?
Okay, here... Wait! Stop whatever you're doing and talk to me.
Fine, fine. What's up?
What are you doing to those rowboats?
Seeing if I can get wheels on them. You're looking at a new stage of amphibious warfare!
And I suppose that this has nothing to do with your little road trip idea?
Of course not. Now, if you'll excuse me... Dang it, why won't you work?
No luck?
I'm always lucky! I didn't say I always had good luck.

Fields.MenuText: Hard work is just as valuable as luck. Just keep at it!
With the size difference, will it matter much anyway?
Exactly how will this revolutionize warfare?

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks, Captain. You're right. A true gambler never quits until the fat cactus sings!
Hey, you're right! Why waste time on these little things when I could try building them on me right now?
Er... Well... The wheels... Combined with the aerohydrodynamics... It's too complicated to explain. But they'll never see it coming!
I kind of wish we had wheels to go onto land right now, though.
Why?
To beach those Morganas. They look like they mean business!
@BATTLE
That's not what I meant.
Shoot! Of all the times...
Nevada, what's wrong?
Looks like my luck's run out. The boilers are on the fritz, and I doubt those BFs are going to wait.
Then we've got to end this fight and quick!
If only I'd concentrated more on that than playing with wheels. Well, you're right - we'll just have to punch above our weight.

Fields.MenuText: A true gambler never throws away her hand.
Just take it easy and rest. We can take it from here.
Your dreams are important, too. Amphibious warfare, remember?

Fields.DialogueText: Heh, she sure doesn't! She just bluffs like Notch Peak. So let's give 'em hell, Captain.
Thanks for being here. But I'm not a helpless maiden. I'll be back on my feet before you know it.
Yeah, and one day we'll be cruising down the highway, into the sunset!
I'm not leaving you, Nevada. We're partners, and we're going to ace straight through these Morganas! Got it?
Looks like I've rubbed off on you. No use feeling sorry for myself. I've got a little strength left in me, Captain. Let's show 'em my good side and make it count!
@BATTLE
Ah! Not a moment too soon. Any longer and I think we'd have blown a boiler.
I wouldn't worry, Nevada. We haven't yet met a Morgana that can beat your armor.
Never say never, Captain. Those girls always have something nasty up their sleeves.
Guess it's a good thing you keep an extra ace or two up yours. It's not cheating if you don't get caught.
Why, Captain! Accusing me of cheating? Those are fighting words where I come from!
Is it really cheating if you're trying to win a war?
All in how you frame it, Captain. I expect them to play tricks and bluff. It's only unfair if I don't trick back.
Hey, Captain, why does the ocean have to be so... wet?
Um... because it's full of water?
I know, but why does it have to be like that? There are lovely mountains and canyons below, so wouldn't it just be nice without all the water?
Well, that's just the way it is. Not much we can do about it. Besides, you're a ship. Shouldn't you like the ocean?
It's just... so cold, so soggy. And it's going to stay that way unless we change it.
Then why don't you stop complaining about it and do something?
You're right. This gives me a great idea!
Oh, what have I done? Nevada, just forget what I said, okay?
Too late, I think I've got it! What if we drained it all up to the moon? Then the Morganas couldn't go anywhere!

Fields.MenuText: But we wouldn't be able to go anywhere either.
The sea has its own good qualities, right?
It's kind of silly for a boat to hate water.

Fields.DialogueText: Not if "Project Wheels On the Boat" works out.
It is decent, I guess. The fish are kind of neat, but it's not as nice as a good old dry-and-dusty desert.
I may be a soldier of the waves, but my home is inland, and it is beautiful. I just hope I can see it again someday.
Anyway, there are Morganas heading our way. We can plan out "Project Moon Tide" later.
When pigs fly.
Oh? I'll hold you to that. This ocean's not the only thing going to the moon!
@BATTLE
Shipment of rations just came in. They flew a plane over to get past the Morgana blockade.
Excellent - that'll keep us going for a while. Help me remember to send formal thanks when we...
Why, Captain, whatever do you mean?
Nevada, I know that look. You're up to something.
Heh, you're getting better at this, Captain. I just wondered if you knew what meats are in the supplies.
Beef, chicken, pork, a little bit of seafood, nothing to worry about. What did you do?
No, it's what you did – or said.
Me?
Yes. Now it's time for you to keep your promise and help me clear the ocean of all this messy water.
I said no such thing!
You said that we'd start on "Project Moon Tide" once pigs fly, and what once was a pig certainly flew onto deck. Let's get cracking!

Fields.MenuText: I didn't say what we would do when pigs fly.
How do you intend to implement this remarkable plan?
No, the Morganas are our top priority.

Fields.DialogueText: Well played, Captain. Looks like I'm a good teacher.
Load up one of those new rockets and send it sky high? I don't know. That's why I asked you. It was your idea, so come up with something.
Lighten up a little, Captain. Put everything on the line and you might have the winning number, even if it's not at your table.
Okay, okay!  But a girl can dream, can't she? Put enough drive into it, and we can swipe fate and make it our own. One step at a time.
Well, then, the first step should be to deal with those Morganas over there.
@BATTLE
... What's with that smirk?
Nevada, where are you?
In here, Captain! Just figuring out what number to do after "Indian Love Call."
What were you wearing just now?
A headdress. You like?
It is not standard uniform, but, yes, it looked good on you. What are you trying to do?
I was thinking - what this fleet really needs is a cabaret routine to spice things up.
And you're going to be the one to do it?
Bingo! I'm just having trouble figuring out how to mesh up the songs and dances. Any ideas?

Fields.MenuText: Go with the flow?
Maybe do something else to take your mind off it for a while.
Show me what you've got.

Fields.DialogueText: Not a bad idea. Just like gambling– if you try to plan out everything beforehand, you'll end up broke.
Some fresh air would be a good change of pace, but I'll keep the headdress on for a little longer. It makes me feel lucky.
My, so forward! Well, how can I refuse?  Watch this!
Thanks for the thoughts, Captain. One way or another, our cabaret is going to be a smash!
Our cabaret?
Well, look at that! Morganas just dropped in. This calls for a tango!
@BATTLE
Katie Casey was baseball mad, had the fever, and had it bad...
Having fun?
Sure am! But we'll need to get the crew in shape for a real game! Okie and Salt Lake said they might be interested in playing against us, so we'll have to do our best!
Good luck. Remember that it's just a game, though.
Of course! It's not like I bet anything that important.
Then what did you bet?
Oh, nothing that big...
But something you don't want to tell me, right?
You know how I'm working on that cabaret routine?
Yes... And?
I maaay have promised that the losers would dance in chicken outfits.

Fields.MenuText: Absolutely not!
We'd better not lose.
Why would you make a bet like that?

Fields.DialogueText: Too late. A bet's a sealed deal once it's made.
Don't worry. I've been practicing for just such an occasion!
Because this way, it's fun whoever wins or loses.
So come on, Captain! We need to practice. I already have the chicken suits ready for the big event.
If we lose.
... Of course. But for now, let's warm up by hitting these Morganas out of the park!
@BATTLE
I spy with my little eye... something wet.
Rain, again.
You got it! Now it's your turn.
Something dark and gloomy, as usual. If the rain doesn't let off soon, the whole day will have been wasted.
Don't say that, Captain! It's been a fun day.
Really? We've done nothing but sit inside here all day.
Sure! We got through all ten rounds of Shanghai, counted raindrops up to ten thousand, and finally got your quarters straightened out.
Shouldn't you be checking on the rest of the ship, though?
Oh, there's nothing big to worry about! Besides, the whole ship is me, so it doesn't matter if I stay in here all day.
Nevada.
Oh, all right. I'll make a patrol of the ship, but you should come too. It's bad for your health to hide from the rain all the time.

Fields.MenuText: But it's so miserable outside.
You're one to talk.
Oh, all right.

Fields.DialogueText: That just means we need to shine brighter and show the world that we're not going let anything make us feel down.
Even if I don't exactly like water, or being wet, that doesn't mean I can't be happy in spite of it. So cheer up!
Good, now it's into the storm. After you.
I have good news and great news, Captain.  Good news: the storm's clearing up.
And the great news?
I see Morganas just within the horizon. One more bit of excitement to liven up the day!
I'd call it bad news, but I guess it's all in the perspective. Get ready to fire.
@BATTLE
At it again?
Yep! How did I do?
I'm no expert, but I think it was pretty good.
Thanks. I think I'm getting the hang of it. Hey, do you know if we'll visit France soon?
Latest reports don't lead me to think it's an urgent priority. I'll let you know if anything changes, though.
Thanks! Just imagine us performing in grand Paris itself! I hear the country roads are nice to travel along.
I thought your road trip was going to be within the United States?
Can't I have both? In fact, while we're at it, let's make it a world tour! Won't it be great?

Fields.MenuText: Road trips usually don't cross multiple continents.
Are we talking about your road trip or your cabaret performance?
Is there any place that you don't want to go?

Fields.DialogueText: They tried it back in '08, you know. This time we'll get it right!
Yes.
Hmmm... The ocean.
Sorry, Captain, but there's just so much that I want to explore out there, and I don't know where to begin.
That's all right. Just make sure you stay alert. We're closing in on some Morganas right now.
Don't worry about me! When push comes to shove, I'm always ready to give it my all.
@BATTLE
Yes to what?
That's a secret!
We're on the ocean right now!
We all have to make sacrifices.
Turn south toward the Carolinas, or straight west to Iowa? Wait, dang it, I forgot about Vermont!
Nevada...
Captain!  I thought you were still on the radio. I... was sorting out your maps.
And crawling all over them, I see.
I was just trying to figure out the route for the road trip. It's a lot harder than I expected.
What seems to be the trouble?
I want to visit a lot of different places– every state and every major landmark. How do I connect them all into a single route?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you should focus more on the journey than the destination.
Whoever said that you can't double back and see the same place twice?
You'll just have to decide what things you want to see and do the most.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. Why ruin the surprise when you can just charge into the unknown?
Yeah, I've been doing this all wrong. The only rules in life are those you chain yourself to.
What I really want... hmm.
Thanks for the help. I'll make our trip into something to remember for a lifetime.
And the maps? What's going to happen with them?
Um...  No time for that! Morganas are coming!
... Some days, Nevada. I'll be on the bridge.
Phew, safe!
I heard that!
@BATTLE
What's cooking this time?
Boiled chicken, with my own secret ingredient.
Nevada...
It's nothing that bad. Promise. Buuuuut if you can guess what it is, I'll make a second one for you.

Fields.MenuText: Jalapeño.
Love?
Garlic.

Fields.DialogueText: Sadly, no. I've used them all up already.
Aren't you a teaser! Everything I make has that ingredient in it, so it's hardly a secret.
No, but maybe we should use it more often. It might keep those bloodsucking Morganas off our backs for once.
The answer is... nothing.
Nothing? But I thought for sure...
Nada. When you say you plan on doing something, the most unpredictable move is to do nothing at all.
I guess I should have trusted my own sense of taste.
That's the most important part of a gamble: trusting your hand to do right by you.
@BATTLE
Let me taste it before I guess?
Well, of course! But commit it to memory. You only get one shot!
Hmm...
Tell you what: I'm in a cooking mood. I'll make you another one once we handle these Morganas.
You're giving me a lot of freebies, Nevada.
Oh, the gamble's over. This is just because you learned your lesson. And because I like you.
Mail call! Looks like you got something, Nevada.
I did? Oh, it's from Saltie!
Salt Lake City?
Yes. This is terrific! We've started sending one another letters while we're out on tour.
What did she say?
She writes that she's trying her hardest to become stronger. Not surprising- she's forever working on her fighting skills.
I'm glad she's doing well. Don't forget to send a reply.
I won't! That reminds me– for the road trip, we just have to take a swim at the Great Salt Lake.  Saltie's told me all about it.

Fields.MenuText: Has she told you anything interesting about it?
There's plenty of salt and water right where we are now.
You might be a little too big to take a dip there.

Fields.DialogueText: Lots! Did you know that there's a crocodile-horse thing lurking there? Maybe we could get a free vacation if we say it's a Morgana.
But the wind there would have the musty scent of sand and stone to balance the flavor.
How rude! The lake is one of the biggest in America, so it should be able to fit my slender body.
I wonder what Saltie's doing right now?
Hopefully not about to face Morganas, like we are.
Well, this'll give me something to write about, won't it? Come on, let's spin a tall tale!
@BATTLE
Somehow I don't think that's a good idea.
Captain, Captain!
What's wrong now?
You need to teach me how to fish, quick!
Why exactly are you in such a hurry to learn?
Well, Oklahoma bragged about catching a huge fish, so I told her I caught one as big as me. Now she wants a photo!

Fields.MenuText: Don't know how to fish, sorry.
Just tell her the truth.
Okay, I'll try to help.

Fields.DialogueText: And you call yourself a sailor!
And let her get the best of me?  I'll show her and catch something twice as big as me!
Thanks, Captain. You're the best.  We'll catch a fish big enough to fry in a pan the size of her state!
Nevada, even if you catch a fish that size, how will you take a picture of it?
We'll cross that bridge when we come to it. For now, time to reel us in some Morganas!
Now there's some catches I wouldn't mind throwing back.
@BATTLE
Ah, Cap'n! Ready for the fish hunt?
I'm not sure this counts as hunting. Don't we wait for fish to come to us?
You're probably right, but I don't feel like swimming. Leave that to the subs. Now sit down! We've got a bet to win.
Nevada, you're supposed to be on  lookout for Morganas.
Ah, who says you can't mix work and pleasure? I'm as alert as ever.
I don't mistrust you...
That'll do. Ooh, I'm already getting a bite!

Fields.MenuText: Nevada, this is a small fry.
Are you going to cook it for me as a reward?
At least give me a chance to catch a bigger one.

Fields.DialogueText: All in how you look at it!
Don't go changing the deal on me! This is a matter of pride!
Mine's big enough for our purposes!
Okay, hold still.
Wait! Set up the tripod first. That way you can hold the fish.
Damn, speaking of whoppers... Keep that picture safe, Captain!
@BATTLE
Grr... Almost... Ha! Quick with the camera, Captain! We'll show Okie who's the real fisher queen!
You're the one who caught it.
And you're the one who's going to keep it in the foreground. I have to get into the background so it looks like a regular sturgeon!
You really think Oklahoma will fall for this?
I won't tell. Will you?
This is so wrong.
Only if we get caught.
Look at that, Captain! Isn't she a whopper?
It's a whopper, all right.
*ALARM*
Nevada, you got another letter.
Thanks!  Let's see... Never mind, it's nothing.
What do you mean?
It's just something from Oklahoma. Nothing worth reading.
Aren't you going to at least open it?
Nah, she's probably just going to rub in that medal she earned. Who needs her?

Fields.MenuText: She's your sister.
You are way better than her.
What's your sister like?

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose you're right.
Of course I am! But, she's pretty good, too, in her own way. Just don't tell her I said that.
She's always acting like she's the best, but one day she'll learn to respect me!
Give me the letter. I'll read it, since you're so curious.
Like I thought, she just wanted to boast about how well she's doing. Waste of time. If you were so interested, you should have just read it yourself.
Let me see.
Hey, wait!
Huh. You never told me you liked water polo.
That's none of your business. Ugh, why do I even bother with her?
Maybe because she ended it with "Love, your Big Sis."
That she did.  I guess I'll have to send her a response– and tell her how I'm doing even better than her.
Whatever floats your boat. So to speak.
Come on, time to hunt some Morganas! I'll show Okie just how strong I can be!
@BATTLE
Nevada! What are you doing?
Watch out, there's...
Ouch!
Please be more careful. You need to watch where you step.
I wonder why? In any case, I wanted to talk to you about this.
Can this wait? I'm a little busy here.
Mining the ship with cactuses?
I know, isn't it great? I managed to order some from Argentina.  Not quite like the ones back home, but still quite lovely.
Cacti is the proper term, I think. Or maybe it's both?  What do you think?
Nevada.
What? It's just a little bit of organic decoration. It has a sultry, desert feel to it, doesn't it?

Fields.MenuText: We're at sea, not in a desert!
What if someone gets hurt?
Why choose cacti, of all things?

Fields.DialogueText: A shame, I know, so hopefully this will improve things.
They're no more dangerous than any other plants, if you're careful. Compared to the Morganas, this should be nothing.
I guess I admire their nature. They have a hardy, prickly spirit that makes their inner beauty and vitality shine all the brighter.
We can keep a few of them, I suppose. But, not on the decks – we need the pathways clear of clutter for battle.
Aye-aye, sir!
Get on it right away. I think we're about to be pricked by some Morganas.
@BATTLE
Captain, could you please sign this paper for me?
Sure, just set it down with the other papers.
Good. Just a couple more signatures, and we'll have enough. If you'll excuse me...
Wait, signatures? Exactly what is this, Nevada?
Oh, it's just a little petition I'm working on. Nothing really, you just need to sign it.
I'll be the judge of that. Let's take a closer look, shall we?
Uh...
Petition?  "Land Channel Bill Proposal – Share the Road With Ships?" Just what are you up to this time?
The wheels are coming along, but the roads are just too small for the road trip. So I came up with a solution.
So you're going to send this to Washington? Call for a continent-wide remodeling of the entire road system?
Of course. This will make things more convenient for everyone.

Fields.MenuText: Everyone, or just you?
This would be a really big change to enact.
Good luck with it.

Fields.DialogueText: Hey, it's not just about me. Sure, the road trip'll be nice, but there must be a lot of us who would like the chance to drive on land.
The world's already changing, Captain! Just look at us and the Morganas. When the game switches tempo, you've got to learn what waves to ride, and what ripples to make.
Thanks! Oklahoma and Salt Lake said they'd sign on it, and I got some of the crew to sign too. Get a few captains too, and they'll just have to listen.
Fine, I'll sign, but it won't make a difference if you can't go on land to begin with.
Don't worry, we'll figure it out someday. We just have to keep moving forward. We'll plow straight through those Morganas in our way!
@BATTLE
I don't like the look of that Morgana fleet ahead.
Yeah, it'll be a tough gamble. But, we can't give up now – everyone's depending on us.
So get ready, because this is going to be a big one.
Yep, it's time to start the show!
Nevada, what are you doing?
I thought I'd go put on my cabaret outfit to boost morale before we get this party started. Want to join in?

Fields.MenuText: Why not?
Knock it off, Nevada. This is serious!
Time to tango with the Morganas, eh?

Fields.DialogueText: That's the spirit! Now shake it and sing! Let's show those witches the good ol' American pride!
So am I, Captain. Those Morganas want us to be afraid.  So the best counter is to smile and laugh, even if we die.
Hahaha! I'm thinking more of a foxtrot, and then one final kick.
Make it quick, Nevada. We're almost there.
Yeah, it'll have to be short and sweet. Fun while it lasts, though.
You're getting better at it.
Thanks! All right, then. Full steam ahead!
You heard the lady. Let's do this!
@BATTLE
Still working on your wheels idea, Nevada?
I had to revise things a little when I found a solution to one of my problems.
What do you mean?
Well, I was thinking that we would need to use the roads for the trip, but who needs them?  We can just sail – and drive – where we please.
You mean off the road?
You've got it! But, that means I need to find something stronger for the ride. Now, what to do...

Fields.MenuText: Why are you so interested in this?
What about cities? You'd have to use streets there, at least.
Driving on land isn't like cruising across the sea, you know.

Fields.DialogueText: Because... I want to see it for myself. I have knowledge of what it's like on land, but it's not the same as witnessing it myself.  Besides, it's an adventure!
Good point. Maybe I could charter a blimp to carry me for those parts. Or how about a dozen helicopters?
So? They both exist under the sky, and they both offer unknown challenges and possibilities beyond the horizon.
Maybe you should just focus on getting the ship to drive on land at all before anything else.
Maybe. I just keep coming up with new ideas to gamble on.
I guess that's just your style.
Well, don't worry. Our trip will be great, whether it's on or off the road.
Let's just hope the Morganas never get the same idea. They don't know when to quit.  Here they come!
@BATTLE
How's it going, Captain?
Okay, I guess. I just hope that we can end this war soon. All of this has gone on for far too long.
Same here. But it can't be that much longer, can it?
No way of knowing. We just have to put all our pride into this until we win.
Agreed. Say, Captain...
What is it?
Do you have any plans for after the war?

Fields.MenuText: I've never really thought about it that much.
Go home, I guess.
See more of the world.

Fields.DialogueText: Really, Captain, you need to think broader. If I'd kept my head in the sand, I would have never come up with the road trip.
Home... That's nice. I kind of wonder... what is my home? Guess I'll just have to figure it out.
Same here.  It's a big world out there. Once the Morganas are gone and things are settled, we can explore all we want.
Though, no matter what happens... I'd like to stay friends.
What do you mean?
Well, I can safely say I've never been on a ship that entertained her crew the way you do. I'd like to see what else you come up with.
Captain...
So, even if we go our separate ways, I want to keep in touch.
Of course! Now let's crush those Morganas together and move one step closer to fulfilling our dream!
@BATTLE
Hey, Captain, you busy?
It depends. Why?
Oh, I was just wondering if you wanted to play a little game of cards.
You always win, no matter the game. Then you take whatever I bet.
This time it will be different. It's something new. Flower cards!
Flowers?
Hand-foot something; it's this Japanese style. I picked up a batch when we were in port.
There are a lot of new games I can play with these. Can we try them, please?

Fields.MenuText: Sorry, but I have to check the refrigerators for termites.
Why not? I feel lucky this time.
No cheating this time.

Fields.DialogueText: No chickening out, Captain, or I'll make you wish you had termites!
Oh? That's my line! Good to see you're ready to roll, but don't expect me to go easy.
I never cheat!
Your move. After we handle those Morganas in front of the ship, that is.
Heh. I'm calling your bluff this time.
Aren't you going to even check?
You check first.
Captain! There are Morganas hard to starboard!
I'll be there! Nevada, I'm sorry I didn't believe you.
Don't be. I'm just amazed that my bluff came true. Lady luck, that's me, all right!
Forget I said anything. But good game, anyway. It was fun.
Thanks. I just hope things stay this way.
@BATTLE
Last time, you said there was a Morgana right behind me so you could stack the deck!
I never stacked anything! That was just a test of battle readiness.
Is something wrong, Nevada? You've been fairly quiet the last few days.
Oh, it's nothing. Just thinking about things.
About what? Salt Lake or Oklahoma?
Oh, no. They're both doing fine.
Then is this about your cabaret routine or your road trip?
Sort of... I don't want to talk about it.
Want to bet?
Huh?
I bet I can make you laugh. If I can, you have to tell me what's wrong.
You know to never bet against me, but I'll humor you. One joke. What'll it be?

Fields.MenuText: What do you call three steaks relaxing and talking with each other?
What happened to the cactus who joined the navy?
A battleship goes on a vacation. What is the first thing she packs?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know, what?
I don't know, what?
I really don't know.
Well, then, I win the bet. So, what's troubling you?
Nothing.
Come on, I won the bet.  You have to tell me.
That's right. But you only asked me to say what is troubling me. And, thanks to you, nothing is wrong now.
Well, at least you're back to your old self.
Thanks. I think there are Morganas approaching, so we had better rally the troops.
Ready as always. Let's do this!
@BATTLE
A chatter-brand!
No, no – a basking cuisine!
He became an admiral– a big prick!
Ha ha! I wonder what the admirals would think of that? Maybe I should send them some cacti from you.
Please don't.
A cannon, so she can lock and load.
Wrong answer, but cute.
Huh?
Hello, Captain!
Hello to you, too. You look happy today.
I finished mapping out our road trip. It's going to be great!
Oh? Let me see?
Here.  See, we'll start at New York like you said, and then we'll weave our way all over the States. What do you think?
It looks like you will have a lot of fun. Wait... "Our" road trip?
Anyway, what outfit do you think I should wear for the cabaret tour?
Nevada.
I... wanted it to be a surprise. But... I was really hoping that this could be for both of us. Please?

Fields.MenuText: Sorry, but I have plans of my own for after the war.
Sure, it sounds like fun.
Why do you want me along?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh...  I hope you have fun, wherever you are. But the war isn't over, so I just have to change your mind before then!
Awesome! This is going to be so wonderful, just you and me!
Isn't it obvious? You're my partner and helped me with my dreams. Of course I want you along.
In any case, you should have just asked me up front.
I... didn't know how you would react.
You can trust me, Nevada. Sure, sometimes I think you're crazy, but we're friends. My door's always open to you, no matter what.
Actually, there's something else I wanted to talk to you about.
What?
*ALARM*
Dang it! The one time I don't want to be interrupted, and this happens!
You can tell me after we're done here. Are you with me?
As always, Captain.
@BATTLE
Good job out there, Nevada.  It looks like we have a reprieve before the next wave.
In that case, we need to talk.
Are you sure? The next batch of Morganas is still close.
I can't wait. You know me, I throw my cards into the wind and risk everything for a lucky strike.
That's you, all right. Does this have something to do what you wanted to say earlier?
Uh... Yes. The thing is, Captain, I don't want you to go away!
What?
I have really enjoyed our time working together, Captain. This road trip... Our whole journey... I can't even imagine it without you there.
Nevada... I don't want to bring you down. But if you end up not being able to-
So, please, Captain, I want to hear it from you. Where do you see your life going, when this is all over?

Fields.MenuText: You're one of my best friends, Nevada. We'll always be together, no matter what.
Of course I'll stay with you. Someone has to drive.

Fields.DialogueText: Damn straight! Just as long as you drive, okay? I want to take in the scenery coast to coast.
Don't hog the wheel all to yourself, now! This is a partnership... and I feel like it's going to be a long one.
You don't think I think about that every day?
Could have fooled me.
I'm a gambler, Captain. I've done the math. I know how hard twenty-some-thousand tons is to get into the water, let alone across a continent.
It's a long shot. And that's why I plan for it. You could sit here and shuffle a deck of cards day and night, and I'd probably rust away long before you got the combination you wanted.
But if you chase something that's one in a million, you have to know what to do with it should you happen to catch it.
